apache.conf.parser

Class DirectiveParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • apache.conf.parser.Parser
      • apache.conf.parser.DirectiveParser

  • public class DirectiveParser
extends Parser
    This class is used to parse the Apache configuration and obtain directives.

    • Method Detail

      • extractDirectiveToParts

        public static java.lang.String[] extractDirectiveToParts(java.lang.String line)

        Takes in a directive and puts it into parts

        Example: "Listen 80 http" will be split into "Listen" "80" "http"

        Parameters:
        line - the line with parts to extract
        Returns:
        an array with the directive parts

      • getDirective

        public Directive[] getDirective(java.lang.String directiveType,
                       boolean includeVHosts)
                         throws java.lang.Exception

        Parses all active configuration files for the directive specified by directiveType.

        Parameters:
        directiveType - The directive name. This is not case sensitive.
        includeVHosts - flag to indicate whether to include directives inside VirtualHosts
        Returns:
        an array with all instances of the directive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDirectiveValue

        public java.lang.String[] getDirectiveValue(java.lang.String directiveType,
                                   boolean includeVHosts)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Parses all active configuration files for the directive values specified by directiveType.

        For example if you search for the directive "Listen" and the apache configuration contains the lines:
        Listen 80
        Listen 443 https
        The function will return an array with values "80" and "443 https".

        Parameters:
        directiveType - The directive name. This is not case sensitive.
        includeVHosts - flag to indicate whether to include directives inside VirtualHosts
        Returns:
        gets all of the values of a directive in an array. If one instance of a directive has multiple values then they will be separated by spaces.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • insertDirectiveBeforeOrAfterFirstFound

        public boolean insertDirectiveBeforeOrAfterFirstFound(java.lang.String directiveType,
                                             java.lang.String directiveString,
                                             boolean before,
                                             boolean includeVHosts)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception

        Inserts a directive string before or after the first found matching directive type.

        For Example:
        If you specify a directive type of "Listen" and a directive String of "Listen 127.0.0.1:80" then this directive String would be inserted after the first "Listen" directive in the configuration.

        Parameters:
        directiveType - The directive name. This is not case sensitive.
        directiveString - The directive string to insert.
        before - a boolean indicating whether the directiveString should be inserted before the first found directive. true for before, false for after.
        includeVHosts - flag to indicate whether to search for directives inside VirtualHosts
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the directive was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • insertDirectiveBeforeOrAfterFirstFound

        public boolean insertDirectiveBeforeOrAfterFirstFound(java.lang.String directiveType,
                                             java.lang.String directiveString,
                                             java.util.regex.Pattern matchesPattern,
                                             boolean before,
                                             boolean includeVHosts)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception

        Inserts a directive string before or after the first found matching directive type and has a value that matches the matchesPattern.

        For Example:
        If you specify a directive type of "Listen", matches "[^0-9]70([^0-9]|)" and a directive String of "Listen 127.0.0.1:80" then this directive String would be inserted after the first "Listen" directive with a value containing the number "70" in the configuration eg. "Listen 70"

        Parameters:
        directiveType - The directive name. This is not case sensitive.
        directiveString - The directive string to insert.
        matchesPattern - A filter that is used to check whether or not the directive matches a certain pattern.
        before - a boolean indicating whether the directiveString should be inserted before or after the first found directive. true for before, false for after.
        includeVHosts - flag to indicate whether to search for directives inside VirtualHosts
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the directive was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDirectiveFile

        public java.lang.String getDirectiveFile(java.lang.String directiveType,
                                java.util.regex.Pattern matchesPattern,
                                boolean includeVHosts)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses the Apache active file list looking for the first file with the directive and pattern combination.
        Parameters:
        directiveType - The directive name. This is not case sensitive.
        matchesPattern - The pattern to match against the directive value.
        includeVHosts - flag to indicate whether to include directives in VirtualHosts
        Returns:
        the first file that matches the directive type and pattern combination or null if no file is found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • removeDirectiveFromFile

        public boolean removeDirectiveFromFile(java.lang.String directiveType,
                              java.lang.String file,
                              java.util.regex.Pattern matchesPattern,
                              boolean commentOut,
                              boolean includeVHosts)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Goes through the target file and removes any lines that match the directive type and pattern.
        Parameters:
        directiveType - The directive name. This is not case sensitive.
        file - The target file.
        matchesPattern - The pattern to match against the directive value.
        commentOut - a boolean indicating if the directive should be commented out rather than completely removed from the file. true to comment out, false to remove.
        includeVHosts - flag to indicate whether to search for directives inside VirtualHosts
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the directive was found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setDirectiveInFile

        public void setDirectiveInFile(java.lang.String directiveType,
                      java.lang.String file,
                      java.lang.String insertValue,
                      java.util.regex.Pattern matchesPattern,
                      boolean add,
                      boolean includeVHosts)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Goes through the target file and replaces the value of any directives that match the directiveType and matchesPattern with the passed in insertValue.
        Parameters:
        directiveType - The directive type. This is not case sensitive.
        file - The target file.
        insertValue - The value to insert.
        matchesPattern - The pattern to match against the directive value.
        add - Specifies whether we should add the directive to the file if it doesn't exist. true to add, false otherwise.
        includeVHosts - flag to indicate whether to search for directives inside VirtualHosts
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
